intro: Saussurea polypodiifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often found at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
